title: Bypass hide download Nextcloud Share

profile.name: Nextcloud
profile.about: Access, share and protect your files, calendars, contacts, communication & more at home and in your enterprise.

vulnerability_information_html:
Summary

Hello everyone, accidentally browsing through nextcloud, I have found a small vulnerability on nextcloud server. This vulnerability allow download the file when the download function has been hidden
Here is the error details.
If anything is wrong please respond to me. Thanks you.

Description

I sharing folder for another ( download not hide)


Of course, the download function is still enabled, I will have the download request as below

I then disabled download on the entire file folder



But the download link created on the server does not change or change the permissions, I can completely download the file to continue


Platform(s) Affected:

Nextcloud Server

Impact

Sensitive documents after sharing that do not allow downloading will be reloaded even if disabled, for anyone

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
This is the intended behaviour. The feature is called "hide download" not "prevent download". Preventing download would make the whole sharing thing useless.
The idea is to remove the download button but still allow the image/video to be opened with the viewer on the Nextcloud. Whenever something is displayed, it is "downloaded". We just don't want to make it too easy with a big "Download file" button in the top right.
activities.markdown_message:

The idea is to remove the download button but still allow the image/video to be opened with the viewer on the Nextcloud. Whenever something is displayed, it is "downloaded". We just don't want to make it too easy with a big "Download file" button in the top right.

activities.message:
This not only works with images or videos as you think, it works with all types of file formats, I have tested this, such as .zip, .rar ..etc
As for photos and videos, it might be normal, but what about other files?
